page.title: 09HOME LIFE
page.content: {A Day in the Life of a Housewife. } We get up around 7.70a.m. and breakfast is at 8.15 with a snack lunch at 12.30 and a cooked meal at 5pm. Tidying the bungalow, making beds and cleaning the bathroom is done daily. Floors are cleaned with an electric vacuum cleaner. Dirty clothes are washed in a washing machine and ironed with an electric iron. Usually the washing is dried outside but when the weather is wet an electric tumble drier is used. Meals, cakes etc. are cooked in an electric oven with rings on top for saucepans. Once a week I go shopping for food. Floweres, vegetables and fruit are grown in the garden some of which are frozen so that they can be eaten in the winter months. Knitting,sewing and decorating are done by me to help stretch the widows pension received.
